01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Global-reset.name: Global reset
01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Global-reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Destyle-rese.name: Destyle reset
01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Destyle-rese.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Sugar-reset.name: Sugar reset
01-basic.sugar.style.resets.Sugar-reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.

01-basic.sugar.style.font.title.description: This declare the @font-face for the "<yellow>title</yellow> font family"

01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Typography.name: Typography
01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Typography.description:
These classes allows you to apply basic typo styles like `sub`, `strong`, etc... on any HTMLElement
These styles are defined in the `theme.typo` theme settings.

example.title: h1
example.code: Desiree Hane I

example.title: h2
example.code: Clark Lockman

example.title: h3
example.code: Carmen Gusikowski

example.title: h4
example.code: Terri Rosenbaum

example.title: h5
example.code: Kristi Runolfsson IV

example.title: h6
example.code: Clarence Reilly

example.title: p
example.code: Herbert Botsford II

example.title: lead
example.code:
<lead class="s-typo:lead">
      Miss Melvin Konopelski
  </lead>

example.title: hr
example.code:
<hr class="s-typo:hr">
      Eduardo Corkery
  </hr>

example.title: pre:not([class])
example.code:
<pre:not([class]) class="s-typo:pre:not([class])">
      Elias Rippin
  </pre:not([class])>

example.title: code:not(pre > code)
example.code:
<code:not(pre > code) class="s-typo:code:not(pre > code)">
      Jody Gottlieb
  </code:not(pre > code)>

example.title: a
example.code: Renee Conn

example.title: quote

      Miss Roy Koelpin
  </quote>

01-basic.sugar.style.Group.name: Group
01-basic.sugar.style.Group.description:
These classes allows you to group elements like s-btn, s-input, etc...
Note that for this to work fine when direction is "rtl", you MUST specify the dir="rtl" attribute
on the html tag

01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Fit-Sizes.name: Fit Sizes
01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Fit-Sizes.description:
These classes allows you to apply a fit size on any HTMLElement.
On image and video, uses `object-fit` property, on all others,
simply fill the element using an absolute position, top: 0, left: 0 and width/height: 100%.

example.title: fill
cover
contain
none

01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Heights.description:

s-height:80

01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Text.name: Text
01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Text.description:
These classes allows to apply some text styling like `text-align: left`, `text-align: right`, `text-decoration: underline`, etc...
directly inside your HTML.

01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Depth.name: Depth
01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Depth.description:
These classes allows you to apply some depth shadows to any HTMLElement.
These depths are defined in the theme configuration under `theme.depth` namespace.

01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Disabled.name: Disabled
01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Disabled.description:
These classes allows you to apply the disabled style on any HTMLElement.
This make sure *no pointer events** stays active as well as displaying the **not-allowed cursor**.

example.title: Disabled
example.code: <input type="text" class="s-input s-disabled" placeholder="I'm disabled" />

01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Offsize.name: Offsize
01-basic.sugar.style.helpers.Offsize.description:
These classes allows you to apply an offsize to any HTMLElement.
An offsize is a "space" that you want to ADD to the width/height of an element.
You can specify where you want to add this offsize like for margin and padding by using the "inline" and "block" notation.

example.title: All around
Inline
Block
Inline end

2

01-basic.sugar.style.tools.Scale.name: Scale
01-basic.sugar.style.tools.Scale.description:
These classes allows to apply a scale to any supported UI elements.
This scale does not use the transform property but increase actual values like `padding`,
`margin`, etc... In fact, all the properties setted with the `sugar.scallable` function.
It's usually a good practice to set the `font-size` of your UI element to `sugar.scalable(1rem)`
and then to set inner values using `em` unit.

example.code:

Scale 11

Luther Fay

01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Icons.name: Icons
01-basic.sugar.style.ui.Icons.description:
These classes represent all the icons that you have listed in your project using the @sugar.icon.classes mixin.
By using this mixin, your icons will be accessible using the same s-icon:{name} classes
independently of the icon source that can be *Fontawesome** or your **Filesystem**.
These providers are the one that we support for now but others can be added if needed.

example.title: Used icons in this website
example.code:
github

Source: fab


discord

Source: fab


twitter

Source: fab


facebook

Source: fab


patreon

Source: fab

global reset.name: Global reset
global reset.description:
These mixins allows you to apply some resets like `destyle` and/or the `sugar` one.
The `destyle` one is well known and you can find the documentation on their website.
The `sugar` one is our own that add some resets like setting max-width to 100% for images, and some more. Check our his own documentation page.

destyle reset.name: Destyle reset
destyle reset.description: These mixins allows you to apply the `destyle` reset easily.

sugar reset.name: Sugar reset
sugar reset.description: This mixin allows you to apply the `sugar` reset easily.
